# File Upload User Stories - Post Start Upload

This document outlines user stories describing what happens from a user perspective after completing the deduplication and upload queue process and clicking the "Start Upload" button.

## User Stories

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility
**As a user**, when I click "Start Upload", **I want** to see immediate visual feedback that the upload process has begun, **so that** I know my action was registered and the system is working.

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress
**As a user**, **I want** to see a progress bar or percentage showing how many files have been uploaded versus the total, **so that** I can estimate how long the remaining upload will take.

### 3. Individual File Upload Status
**As a user**, **I want** to see the status of individual files (uploading, completed, failed) in the queue, **so that** I can identify any problematic files that need attention.

### 4. Upload Speed Information
**As a user**, **I want** to see the current upload speed (MB/s or files/min), **so that** I can understand if my connection is performing well and estimate completion time.

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability
**As a user**, **I want** to be able to pause the upload process if needed, **so that** I can manage my bandwidth or stop the process without losing progress.

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery
**As a user**, when a file fails to upload, **I want** to see clear error messages and have options to retry, **so that** I can resolve issues without restarting the entire process.

### 7. Duplicate File Handling
**As a user**, when the system encounters files that already exist in storage, **I want** to identify and log differences in file names, folder path, and meta data for files with identical SHA256 hash values **so that** all metadata information is preserved.

### 8. Interruption Recovery
**As a user**, if my upload is interrupted during upload, **I want** the system to pickup from where we left off **so that** we don't repeat the same work.

### 9. Thorough and reliable bulk uploading
**As a user**, if a file upload starts, **I want** the database to track whether the upload completed successfully **so that** we can ensure that all files are uploaded.

### 10. Upload Completion Notification
**As a user**, when all files have been successfully uploaded, **I want** to receive a clear completion message with a summary of results, **so that** I know the process finished and can see what was accomplished.

### 11. Failed Upload Summary
**As a user**, after the upload process completes, **I want** to see a summary of any failed uploads with reasons, **so that** I can address issues and retry if needed.

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation
**As a user**, **I want** the ability to cancel the entire upload process if needed, **so that** I can stop unwanted uploads without waiting for completion.

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to review the upload results file by file, **so that** I can see details of the upload results..

### 14. Cleanup and Reset
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to control clearing of the upload the upload queue, **so that** I can begin a new upload session without confusion from previous data.

## Solution Brainstorming

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility Solutions
- **Immediate UI State Change**: Toggle button to "Uploading..." state with spinner, disable interaction, show progress modal immediately
- **Progressive Loading States**: Multi-stage feedback (preparing ‚Üí starting ‚Üí uploading) with visual transitions between states
- **Toast + Modal Combination**: Brief toast notification for immediate feedback, then transition to detailed progress modal

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress Solutions
- **Simple Progress Bar**: Linear progress bar showing completed/total files with percentage, updated via Firebase upload progress callbacks
- **Dual Progress Display**: Combined file count progress and data size progress bars to show both metrics simultaneously
- **Animated Progress Ring**: Circular progress indicator with file count overlay and smooth animations for visual appeal

### 3. Individual File Upload Status Solutions
- **Status Icon System**: Color-coded icons (pending/uploading/completed/failed) next to each file in scrollable list
- **Expandable Queue View**: Collapsible detailed view showing current file being processed with full queue visible on demand
- **Real-time List Updates**: Live-updating file list with status badges and progress indicators per file

### 4. Upload Speed Information Solutions
- **Running Average Display**: Calculate and display MB/s or files/min using rolling window of recent upload times
- **Dynamic Speed Graph**: Mini-chart showing upload speed over time with current speed highlighted
- **Contextual Speed Indicators**: Speed display with performance indicators (slow/normal/fast) and estimated completion time

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability Solutions
- **State-based Control**: Pause button that stops current upload, saves queue state, allows resume from exact position
- **Graceful Interruption**: Complete current file upload before pausing to avoid partial uploads and data corruption
- **Background State Persistence**: Save upload progress to localStorage/IndexedDB for resume across browser sessions

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery Solutions
- **Retry Queue System**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff, manual retry button for persistent failures
- **Error Detail Modal**: Detailed error information with suggested actions (check connection, file permissions, etc.)
- **Selective Recovery**: Allow users to skip failed files, retry individual files, or retry all failed files at once

### 7. Duplicate File Handling Solutions
- **Metadata Logging System**: Store file metadata (original path, name, timestamps) in Firestore even when content is duplicate
- **Duplicate Reference Tracking**: Create lightweight document references that point to existing file content but preserve unique metadata
- **Version Management**: Track multiple instances of same content with different metadata as separate "versions" of the file

### 8. Interruption Recovery Solutions
- **Checkpoint System**: Save upload progress at regular intervals, detect incomplete uploads on restart
- **Browser Session Recovery**: Use beforeunload event and localStorage to detect interrupted uploads and offer resume
- **Firebase Resume Logic**: Query uploaded files on restart to determine queue position and continue from interruption point

### 9. Thorough and Reliable Bulk Uploading Solutions
- **Upload Transaction Tracking**: Create upload batch record in Firestore, mark files as uploaded only after successful storage + database write
- **Atomic Upload Operations**: Ensure both file storage and metadata database writes succeed together or both fail
- **Upload Verification System**: Post-upload verification that compares uploaded file metadata against original queue for completeness

### 10. Upload Completion Notification Solutions
- **Success Modal with Summary**: Detailed completion modal showing total files, data uploaded, time elapsed, any issues encountered
- **Browser Notification**: System notification (if permitted) for completion when user is in different tab/window
- **Email/Dashboard Summary**: Post-upload summary report saved to user dashboard or optionally emailed

### 11. Failed Upload Summary Solutions
- **Categorized Error Report**: Group failures by error type (network, permission, size, etc.) with actionable solutions
- **Downloadable Error Log**: Export detailed error report as CSV/JSON for technical analysis or support
- **Interactive Failure Review**: Click-through interface to review each failed file with retry options and error details

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation Solutions
- **Immediate Stop with Cleanup**: Cancel button that stops all uploads immediately and cleans up partial uploads
- **Graceful Cancellation**: Complete current file uploads then stop, preserving successfully uploaded files
- **Confirmation Dialog**: Two-step cancellation (button + confirmation) to prevent accidental cancellation of large uploads

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review Solutions
- **Searchable Upload Results Table**: Sortable, filterable table of all uploaded files with status, errors, metadata
- **Upload History Dashboard**: Persistent record of upload sessions with drill-down capability for detailed review
- **File-by-File Inspection**: Modal or detail view for individual file upload results including metadata and any processing notes

### 14. Cleanup and Reset Solutions
- **Manual Clear Controls**: Separate buttons for "Clear Completed", "Clear All", "Clear Failed" with confirmation dialogs
- **Automatic Cleanup Options**: User preference settings for auto-clear behavior (immediate, after delay, manual only)
- **Session-based Reset**: Automatic queue clearing when starting new upload session with option to preserve previous results

# File Upload User Stories - Post Start Upload

This document outlines user stories describing what happens from a user perspective after completing the deduplication and upload queue process and clicking the "Start Upload" button.

## User Stories

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility
**As a user**, when I click "Start Upload", **I want** to see immediate visual feedback that the upload process has begun, **so that** I know my action was registered and the system is working.

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress
**As a user**, **I want** to see a progress bar or percentage showing how many files have been uploaded versus the total, **so that** I can estimate how long the remaining upload will take.

### 3. Individual File Upload Status
**As a user**, **I want** to see the status of individual files (uploading, completed, failed) in the queue, **so that** I can identify any problematic files that need attention.

### 4. Upload Speed Information
**As a user**, **I want** to see the current upload speed (MB/s or files/min), **so that** I can understand if my connection is performing well and estimate completion time.

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability
**As a user**, **I want** to be able to pause the upload process if needed, **so that** I can manage my bandwidth or stop the process without losing progress.

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery
**As a user**, when a file fails to upload, **I want** to see clear error messages and have options to retry, **so that** I can resolve issues without restarting the entire process.

### 7. Duplicate File Handling
**As a user**, when the system encounters files that already exist in storage, **I want** to identify and log differences in file names, folder path, and meta data for files with identical SHA256 hash values **so that** all metadata information is preserved.

### 8. Interruption Recovery
**As a user**, if my upload is interrupted during upload, **I want** the system to pickup from where we left off **so that** we don't repeat the same work.

### 9. Thorough and reliable bulk uploading
**As a user**, if a file upload starts, **I want** the database to track whether the upload completed successfully **so that** we can ensure that all files are uploaded.

### 10. Upload Completion Notification
**As a user**, when all files have been successfully uploaded, **I want** to receive a clear completion message with a summary of results, **so that** I know the process finished and can see what was accomplished.

### 11. Failed Upload Summary
**As a user**, after the upload process completes, **I want** to see a summary of any failed uploads with reasons, **so that** I can address issues and retry if needed.

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation
**As a user**, **I want** the ability to cancel the entire upload process if needed, **so that** I can stop unwanted uploads without waiting for completion.

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to review the upload results file by file, **so that** I can see details of the upload results..

### 14. Cleanup and Reset
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to control clearing of the upload the upload queue, **so that** I can begin a new upload session without confusion from previous data.

## Solution Brainstorming

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility Solutions
- **Immediate UI State Change**: Toggle button to "Uploading..." state with spinner, disable interaction, show progress modal immediately
- **Progressive Loading States**: Multi-stage feedback (preparing ‚Üí starting ‚Üí uploading) with visual transitions between states
- **Toast + Modal Combination**: Brief toast notification for immediate feedback, then transition to detailed progress modal

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress Solutions
- **Simple Progress Bar**: Linear progress bar showing completed/total files with percentage, updated via Firebase upload progress callbacks
- **Dual Progress Display**: Combined file count progress and data size progress bars to show both metrics simultaneously
- **Animated Progress Ring**: Circular progress indicator with file count overlay and smooth animations for visual appeal

### 3. Individual File Upload Status Solutions
- **Status Icon System**: Color-coded icons (pending/uploading/completed/failed) next to each file in scrollable list
- **Expandable Queue View**: Collapsible detailed view showing current file being processed with full queue visible on demand
- **Real-time List Updates**: Live-updating file list with status badges and progress indicators per file

### 4. Upload Speed Information Solutions
- **Running Average Display**: Calculate and display MB/s or files/min using rolling window of recent upload times
- **Dynamic Speed Graph**: Mini-chart showing upload speed over time with current speed highlighted
- **Contextual Speed Indicators**: Speed display with performance indicators (slow/normal/fast) and estimated completion time

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability Solutions
- **State-based Control**: Pause button that stops current upload, saves queue state, allows resume from exact position
- **Graceful Interruption**: Complete current file upload before pausing to avoid partial uploads and data corruption
- **Background State Persistence**: Save upload progress to localStorage/IndexedDB for resume across browser sessions

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery Solutions
- **Retry Queue System**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff, manual retry button for persistent failures
- **Error Detail Modal**: Detailed error information with suggested actions (check connection, file permissions, etc.)
- **Selective Recovery**: Allow users to skip failed files, retry individual files, or retry all failed files at once

### 7. Duplicate File Handling Solutions
- **Metadata Logging System**: Store file metadata (original path, name, timestamps) in Firestore even when content is duplicate
- **Duplicate Reference Tracking**: Create lightweight document references that point to existing file content but preserve unique metadata
- **Version Management**: Track multiple instances of same content with different metadata as separate "versions" of the file

### 8. Interruption Recovery Solutions
- **Checkpoint System**: Save upload progress at regular intervals, detect incomplete uploads on restart
- **Browser Session Recovery**: Use beforeunload event and localStorage to detect interrupted uploads and offer resume
- **Firebase Resume Logic**: Query uploaded files on restart to determine queue position and continue from interruption point

### 9. Thorough and Reliable Bulk Uploading Solutions
- **Upload Transaction Tracking**: Create upload batch record in Firestore, mark files as uploaded only after successful storage + database write
- **Atomic Upload Operations**: Ensure both file storage and metadata database writes succeed together or both fail
- **Upload Verification System**: Post-upload verification that compares uploaded file metadata against original queue for completeness

### 10. Upload Completion Notification Solutions
- **Success Modal with Summary**: Detailed completion modal showing total files, data uploaded, time elapsed, any issues encountered
- **Browser Notification**: System notification (if permitted) for completion when user is in different tab/window
- **Email/Dashboard Summary**: Post-upload summary report saved to user dashboard or optionally emailed

### 11. Failed Upload Summary Solutions
- **Categorized Error Report**: Group failures by error type (network, permission, size, etc.) with actionable solutions
- **Downloadable Error Log**: Export detailed error report as CSV/JSON for technical analysis or support
- **Interactive Failure Review**: Click-through interface to review each failed file with retry options and error details

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation Solutions
- **Immediate Stop with Cleanup**: Cancel button that stops all uploads immediately and cleans up partial uploads
- **Graceful Cancellation**: Complete current file uploads then stop, preserving successfully uploaded files
- **Confirmation Dialog**: Two-step cancellation (button + confirmation) to prevent accidental cancellation of large uploads

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review Solutions
- **Searchable Upload Results Table**: Sortable, filterable table of all uploaded files with status, errors, metadata
- **Upload History Dashboard**: Persistent record of upload sessions with drill-down capability for detailed review
- **File-by-File Inspection**: Modal or detail view for individual file upload results including metadata and any processing notes

### 14. Cleanup and Reset Solutions
- **Manual Clear Controls**: Separate buttons for "Clear Completed", "Clear All", "Clear Failed" with confirmation dialogs
- **Automatic Cleanup Options**: User preference settings for auto-clear behavior (immediate, after delay, manual only)
- **Session-based Reset**: Automatic queue clearing when starting new upload session with option to preserve previous results

# File Upload User Stories - Post Start Upload

This document outlines user stories describing what happens from a user perspective after completing the deduplication and upload queue process and clicking the "Start Upload" button.

## User Stories

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility
**As a user**, when I click "Start Upload", **I want** to see immediate visual feedback that the upload process has begun, **so that** I know my action was registered and the system is working.

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress
**As a user**, **I want** to see a progress bar or percentage showing how many files have been uploaded versus the total, **so that** I can estimate how long the remaining upload will take.

### 3. Individual File Upload Status
**As a user**, **I want** to see the status of individual files (uploading, completed, failed) in the queue, **so that** I can identify any problematic files that need attention.

### 4. Upload Speed Information
**As a user**, **I want** to see the current upload speed (MB/s or files/min), **so that** I can understand if my connection is performing well and estimate completion time.

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability
**As a user**, **I want** to be able to pause the upload process if needed, **so that** I can manage my bandwidth or stop the process without losing progress.

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery
**As a user**, when a file fails to upload, **I want** to see clear error messages and have options to retry, **so that** I can resolve issues without restarting the entire process.

### 7. Duplicate File Handling
**As a user**, when the system encounters files that already exist in storage, **I want** to identify and log differences in file names, folder path, and meta data for files with identical SHA256 hash values **so that** all metadata information is preserved.

### 8. Interruption Recovery
**As a user**, if my upload is interrupted during upload, **I want** the system to pickup from where we left off **so that** we don't repeat the same work.

### 9. Thorough and reliable bulk uploading
**As a user**, if a file upload starts, **I want** the database to track whether the upload completed successfully **so that** we can ensure that all files are uploaded.

### 10. Upload Completion Notification
**As a user**, when all files have been successfully uploaded, **I want** to receive a clear completion message with a summary of results, **so that** I know the process finished and can see what was accomplished.

### 11. Failed Upload Summary
**As a user**, after the upload process completes, **I want** to see a summary of any failed uploads with reasons, **so that** I can address issues and retry if needed.

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation
**As a user**, **I want** the ability to cancel the entire upload process if needed, **so that** I can stop unwanted uploads without waiting for completion.

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to review the upload results file by file, **so that** I can see details of the upload results..

### 14. Cleanup and Reset
**As a user**, after uploading completes, **I want** the ability to control clearing of the upload the upload queue, **so that** I can begin a new upload session without confusion from previous data.

## Solution Brainstorming

### 1. Upload Progress Visibility Solutions
- **üèÜ Immediate UI State Change**: Toggle button to "Uploading..." state with spinner, disable interaction, show progress modal immediately
- **Progressive Loading States**: Multi-stage feedback (preparing ‚Üí starting ‚Üí uploading) with visual transitions between states
- **Toast + Modal Combination**: Brief toast notification for immediate feedback, then transition to detailed progress modal

### 2. Real-Time Upload Progress Solutions
- **Simple Progress Bar**: Linear progress bar showing completed/total files with percentage, updated via Firebase upload progress callbacks
- **Dual Progress Display**: Combined file count progress and data size progress bars to show both metrics simultaneously
- **Animated Progress Ring**: Circular progress indicator with file count overlay and smooth animations for visual appeal

### 3. Individual File Upload Status Solutions
- **Status Icon System**: Color-coded icons (pending/uploading/completed/failed) next to each file in scrollable list
- **Expandable Queue View**: Collapsible detailed view showing current file being processed with full queue visible on demand
- **Real-time List Updates**: Live-updating file list with status badges and progress indicators per file

### 4. Upload Speed Information Solutions
- **Running Average Display**: Calculate and display MB/s or files/min using rolling window of recent upload times
- **Dynamic Speed Graph**: Mini-chart showing upload speed over time with current speed highlighted
- **Contextual Speed Indicators**: Speed display with performance indicators (slow/normal/fast) and estimated completion time

### 5. Pause and Resume Capability Solutions
- **State-based Control**: Pause button that stops current upload, saves queue state, allows resume from exact position
- **Graceful Interruption**: Complete current file upload before pausing to avoid partial uploads and data corruption
- **Background State Persistence**: Save upload progress to localStorage/IndexedDB for resume across browser sessions

### 6. Error Handling and Recovery Solutions
- **Retry Queue System**: Automatic retry with exponential backoff, manual retry button for persistent failures
- **Error Detail Modal**: Detailed error information with suggested actions (check connection, file permissions, etc.)
- **Selective Recovery**: Allow users to skip failed files, retry individual files, or retry all failed files at once

### 7. Duplicate File Handling Solutions
- **Metadata Logging System**: Store file metadata (original path, name, timestamps) in Firestore even when content is duplicate
- **Duplicate Reference Tracking**: Create lightweight document references that point to existing file content but preserve unique metadata
- **Version Management**: Track multiple instances of same content with different metadata as separate "versions" of the file

### 8. Interruption Recovery Solutions
- **Checkpoint System**: Save upload progress at regular intervals, detect incomplete uploads on restart
- **Browser Session Recovery**: Use beforeunload event and localStorage to detect interrupted uploads and offer resume
- **Firebase Resume Logic**: Query uploaded files on restart to determine queue position and continue from interruption point

### 9. Thorough and Reliable Bulk Uploading Solutions
- **Upload Transaction Tracking**: Create upload batch record in Firestore, mark files as uploaded only after successful storage + database write
- **Atomic Upload Operations**: Ensure both file storage and metadata database writes succeed together or both fail
- **Upload Verification System**: Post-upload verification that compares uploaded file metadata against original queue for completeness

### 10. Upload Completion Notification Solutions
- **Success Modal with Summary**: Detailed completion modal showing total files, data uploaded, time elapsed, any issues encountered
- **Browser Notification**: System notification (if permitted) for completion when user is in different tab/window
- **Email/Dashboard Summary**: Post-upload summary report saved to user dashboard or optionally emailed

### 11. Failed Upload Summary Solutions
- **Categorized Error Report**: Group failures by error type (network, permission, size, etc.) with actionable solutions
- **Downloadable Error Log**: Export detailed error report as CSV/JSON for technical analysis or support
- **Interactive Failure Review**: Click-through interface to review each failed file with retry options and error details

### 12. Batch Upload Cancellation Solutions
- **Immediate Stop with Cleanup**: Cancel button that stops all uploads immediately and cleans up partial uploads
- **Graceful Cancellation**: Complete current file uploads then stop, preserving successfully uploaded files
- **Confirmation Dialog**: Two-step cancellation (button + confirmation) to prevent accidental cancellation of large uploads

### 13. Post-Upload Detailed Review Solutions
- **Searchable Upload Results Table**: Sortable, filterable table of all uploaded files with status, errors, metadata
- **Upload History Dashboard**: Persistent record of upload sessions with drill-down capability for detailed review
- **File-by-File Inspection**: Modal or detail view for individual file upload results including metadata and any processing notes

### 14. Cleanup and Reset Solutions
- **Manual Clear Controls**: Separate buttons for "Clear Completed", "Clear All", "Clear Failed" with confirmation dialogs
- **Automatic Cleanup Options**: User preference settings for auto-clear behavior (immediate, after delay, manual only)
- **Session-based Reset**: Automatic queue clearing when starting new upload session with option to preserve previous results
